entry.title: Ordered List in HTML – OL Tag Example
entry.summary: An ordered list is a list in which the items are numbered and the order matters. This is as opposed to an unordered list where the items are bulleted by default (and the order doesn't matter). Basic Syntax of the <ol> tag The <ol> tag defines ordered lists in HTML.
